response.message: I'd like to be the first (on the blog anyway) to congratulate rchern, Chrisf, phwd and Senseful, and the whole StackExchange team!

Congrats. Gaming next?

I must say though, I think it's too grey. That was my first reaction and after surfing around it a bit, it kinda annoyed me. But that's just me :-)
Ugh... I really liked that cool beta skin... Why's it been changed now to that Faux-SX look?  >_<

No offence, but the design is awful. Fonts are bad, poorly sized, the logo makes no sense to me. I'm not a designer, but the one that you use to launch all betas is much much better.

P.S. Please take this as constructive criticism, not hate.

Hey folks, how about discussing the design of a site *prior* to its launch, on its Meta? You have a full 90 days to voice your concerns!

http://meta.webapps.stackexchange.com/questions/559/design-ideas-for-web-applications-site-updated-with-screenshots

http://meta.gaming.stackexchange.com/questions/982/design-ideas-for-gaming-site-updated-with-screenshots-v2

http://meta.cooking.stackexchange.com/questions/783/design-ideas-for-cooking-site

etc.
Slavo - I like it, so I guess to each his own?
Care to comment on why the name was briefly "Nothing to Install" before being reverted back? I read the thread on meta about it but I'm still not quite sure what happened.
Please fix the ugly and hard to read styling. :(
Excellent - simply because I have no knowledge of or  interest in, web apps and there now wont be any on SO!
